pullRequest.body:
Add a recursion principal defining functions with domain `Iio o` for an ordinal `o`.

---

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

This has been discussed in #14060.

Thanks! Hopefully I didn't come off as too harsh during the review. There's just a lot of weird idiosyncrasies in this part of the library that need to be cleaned up...

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
  added to all cases. The final term's domain is the ordinals below `l`. -/
```

Note that in the current API, `succ o` is the preferred form to `o + 1`. There are however plans to change this in the near future, so I'll leave to you keeping this as `o + 1` or changing it to `succ o`.
This argument was at the start in `limitRecOn`, so I think it'd be good matching that and renaming this to `boundedLimitRecOn`.

I did it because I liked `boundedLimitRec h H₁ H₂ H₃` being the function I'm constructing, rather then `fun o ↦ boundedLimitRec o h H₁ H₂ H₃`. But looking at it it's not a big difference so I'll change it.
I really don't think this is necessary. The elaborator can be a bit finicky when using recursive principles, but usually the fix is just using `refine` or `induction` instead of `apply`.
We don't have many `simp` lemmas on specific limit ordinals, so in practice this will rarely if ever fire as a `simp` lemma. `limitRecOn_limit` shouldn't have been a `simp` lemma either.
How come this is written with `succ` but the definition of `boundedLimitRec` is written with `o + 1`?

```suggestion
  rw [boundedLimitRec, limitRecOn_zero]
```

```suggestion
  rw [boundedLimitRec, limitRecOn_succ] 
  rfl
```
You use `hLim` for the limit hypothesis here, but `lLim` elsewhere. Can you choose either one?

```suggestion
  rw [boundedLimitRec, limitRecOn_limit _ _ _ _ oLim]
  rfl
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (Mathlib/SetTheory/Ordinal/Arithmetic): add bounded recursion on ordinals
